TLINE.TDLINE: &USE&
A series of implementations regarding the specific objects in the gicom
Suite require the assignment of clear numbers. All implementations use
the SAP number allocation, which arranges the number allocation via
number range objects.
For the implementations in the gicom Suite own number range objects must
be defined.
&PRECONDITIONS&
&STANDARD_SETUP&
&ACTIVITY&
Number range objects are entered via the transaction SNRO.
Step 1: Maintain Access Number Range Objects
Step 2: Customizing of the number Range Object
Short text: Enter a short description for the number range object. This
description can be freely selected and is relevant for the future
allocation.
Long text: Enter a long description for the number range object.
Number Length Domain: gicom domains for which the length of the number
range number is defined.
% Warning: Percentage value of the remaining numbers. When this value is
reached, a warning is given.
Sub object Data Element: Optional field which determines whether the
number allocation depends on the sub object (for example, the company
code "BUKRS"). Here the SAP default name must be entered.
To-year flag: Indicator which indicates whether the numbers of the
number range object must be reset for the new business year.
No rolling: Setting of the switch prevents the intervals of the number
range object to start again from the beginning. This way no numbers are
allocated twice.
Step 3: Customizing the Number Range Object
Number range transaction: Transaction name for the maintenance of this
number range object.
Buffering: Definition whether the system uses a number range buffer. The
performance will be increased if for a number request the numbers are
read from the buffer and not from the database. If all numbers are used
in the puffer, new numbers are loaded from the database table to the
buffer. If no buffering is used, with a number request the corresponding
table entry is always blocked until the operation is completed. After
this process, a new number can be allocated. The resulting higher
collection of requests with their sequential processing decreases the
performance.
No. of Numbers in Buffer: Amount of numbers which are situated in the
buffer.
&EXAMPLE&
Number range object for Agreement is /GICOM/AGRMT_ID
